<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 4"
    pfs="Limited"
>
[Seeker of Truths](/Feats.aspx?ID=2659) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Archetype" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=12" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #164: Hands of the Devil](/Sources.aspx?ID=75) pg. 76</row>

**Archetype** [Eldritch Researcher](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=89)

**Prerequisites**
[Eldritch Researcher Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=2658)

</column>

---

Your devotion to discovering and hoarding abstruse truths borders on the fanatical, and you can bring this devotion to bear. You gain the cleric's [Domain Initiate](/Feats.aspx?ID=265) feat but must select [knowledge](/Domains.aspx?ID=17), [secrecy](/Domains.aspx?ID=28), or [truth](/Domains.aspx?ID=32) as your domain. You cast that domain's domain spell as a focus spell of the same tradition as your cantrip from Eldritch Researcher Dedication, and you [Refocus](/Actions.aspx?ID=71) by contemplating abstruse mysteries rather than praying to a god. When an ability would manifest a divine symbol—such as the [_word of truth_](/Spells.aspx?ID=471) focus spell—it instead manifests as a strange shape unique to you that seems to defy geometry.

**Special** You can take this feat up to three times, selecting a different domain each time.

<title level="2">Seeker of Truths leads to...</title>
[Advanced Seeker of Truths](/Feats.aspx?ID=2665)
